comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment:
This is a massive change from where we previously were retrieving the employer.
Aparently we now need an employment on the leave request side in order for the organization to be infered.
How do we configure this employment? Do we need to go though all the intake process to select this employment?

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment: Yes. One of the intake steps requires the selection of the employment record.

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment:
This is a generic method that receives "roleName" as an argument. Why is this particular role being used here instead of the "roleName"?
why was this method changed in the first place?
Don't understand this change.

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment: This will be handled by Taj

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment: This method could be moved to the LeaveRequestService that in turn would use the create and remove partycaserole methods in the AbsenceCaseService, thus delegating the work.

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment: Why? This is a service of the absence case. Not currently related with the LeaveRequest.

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment:
Why are these methods public accessed?
These should be private and they should be removed once the @Inject in working properly.
Why are we testing supported methods?
Are these methods public just for testing purposes? These are not part of the service and should not be made public?

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment:
Why is this method here?
This method should be in the LeaveRequestPersistenceService.
It does nothing related with the AbsenceCase.
